Panoramic Screenshot

A tool that automatically merges several screenshots of a continuous list into one, which is called \"Panoramic Screenshot\" or \"Long Screenshot\".

Panoramic Screenshot is free software, licensed under GNU General Public License version 3 or later. Source code and license text available at http://github.com/PaperAirplane-Dev-Team/Panoramic-Screenshot

Usage

1. Start this app and click on the \"+\" icon
2. Go to the app page you want to take screenshot of.
3. Scroll to top, take a screenshot.
4. Scroll down a little, take another.
5. Repeat 4 until you finish.
6. Click the notification, adjust the settings, and click the tick.

Above are only steps for normal apps with a list. All you need to do is keep a visible common part between two screenshots taken. This is to ensure that the final output is continuous.

Requirements

1. The screenshoted app\'s title should not change between two screenshots.
2. The bottom bar (if any) of the app should not change or only change slightly.
3. The list should have a solid background.
4. A list item should not vary in style when it is scrolled.
5. A common part must be kept between two shots, at least larger than the \"top shadow\" value in settings. If not, the screenshot may end up uncontinuous or may fail.
6. This app currently does not work with:
(1) Apps without actionbar (toolbar) or with a changing top part.
(2) Apps with FAB (Floating Action Button) or anything at the bottom line that is persistent and (partly) transparent.
(3) If the top part collapses, please make sure that it appears only on one screenshot.
(4) Scrollbars should for now be avoided.
